text: Gentile Valley is a valley in the U.S. state of Idaho. Gentile Valley was named out of anti-Mormon prejudice. Non-Mormons were commonly called gentiles, and with the name the early settlers of Gentile Valley let it be known that Mormons were not welcome there. ==References== Category:Landforms of Caribou County, Idaho Category:Landforms of Franklin County, Idaho Category:Valleys of Idaho Category:Religious discrimination in the United States
title: Gentile Valley
